data.text: @DavidHyndman1 Kanye is apart of the black community no matter what anyone thinks, the man is black and has major influence. There is no debate, only fact. Many of us want to see him get out of this “trump trance” he’s been in where he makes controversial statements (about his own race)

@DavidHyndman1 I’ll say it once again, when you have as much influence as Kanye, everything you say is magnified and can have an impact in many ways. Everyone knows the so called “photus” was using him to get support from the black community. Kanye apparently is aware of this now

@DavidHyndman1 Not sure what your ethnicity is but let me tell you like it is. Most blacks like myself feel completely betrayed after the hurtful things he has stated about slavery. That scar runs deep through the entire community.
@DavidHyndman1 When you have as much influence as Kanye does, ESPECIALLY IN THE BLACK COMMUNITY, your words and opinions are magnified.

@ludoklack @Poketwon We all know @kanyewest can't articulate his thought very well. He didn't mean he wanted to abolish the 13th amendment but some sort of reform. I don't think the issue lies with the 13th amendment at all. But I get where Kanye is coming from about mental health
@ludoklack @Poketwon I tried, I've come up with nothing
@MotarMouthMotta You gotta do your research bro. Check out his comments about slavery
@Poketwon Please explain what he said that was so hurtful.
@Poketwon That's cool you saw them and I agree he's said some harmful stuff and just acts like it's fine.
